events.comment: Create the joints
Area 1: Simple distance joint
Area 2: A revolute joint between two objects with limits and a simple revolute joint with motor
Area 3: Prismatic joint with limits and motor
Area 4: Pulley joint, the ground anchors are located a bit above the objects

Area 5:
* A prismatic joint between a static box and a box >> Joint A
* A revolute joint between a static box and a circle >> Joint B
* A revolute joint in a fixed place >> Joint C

* A gear joint between joints A and B
* A gear joint between joints B and C

(Note that joints A, B and C have a static object as first object in the joint, even the fixed revolute joint)
Area 6: Two circles attached to a box through wheel joints

Area 7: Two circles and a box joined through weld joints

(Note that the two circles are located in different layers to avoid forced collisions)
Area 8: The mouse joint object, nothing to configure here as the joint is continuously created and deleted on mouse clicks
Area 9: Simple rope joint

Area 10: Simple friction joint with offsets

(Note that the circle is not affected by gravity through its gravity scale)
Area 11: Two motor joints. A box and a circle try to reach a target position/angle from a static box

Area 12:
* Two levers strongly attached to the world through fixed revolute joints
* The levers are attached to each other with a revolute joint, softer than the previous ones

In other events the soft revolute joint reaction force is checked to determine if the joint must break

(Note that the initial position is very important here, a big offset from the balance position makes the soft joint to suffer each frame, continuously increasing the joint reaction force)
Update the mouse joint, dragging events, and breakable joint
Each time "t" is pressed, halve the world time scale
Change the gravity with "g"
Click on a Draggable object (almost every object in screen) >> Flag it as dragging
Click on the mouse joint box >> Create a mouse joint and attach it to the object
While mouse button is pressed, update the joint target position to the cursor position
Mouse button released >> Flag every object as non-dragging and remove the mouse joint
Move the dragging object to the cursor position
The breakable revolute joint reaction force is greater than a critical value >> Break the joint
The debug drawing events, you don't want to look at this
